full_summary:
===============

**Meal Preparation and Delivery Tender Announcement**
--------------------------------------------------------

**Reference Number:** cb-7690-95024108
**Publication Date:** July 28, 2023
**Tender Closing Date:** August 25, 2023, 14:00:00

**Solicitation Synopsis**

The Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA) requires a contractor to provide meal preparation and delivery services to facilitate the nutritional needs of asylum seekers arriving at the Saint-Bernard-de-Lacolle port of entry. Due to the high volume of asylum seekers, the CBSA must ensure that essential nutritional needs are met while processing them on-site at the Lacolle site.

**Key Requirements**

* Prepare and deliver meals and snacks upon request to 339 Guay Road, St-Bernard-de-Lacolle, QC, J0J 1V0
* Ensure that deliveries are made within a timeframe that takes into account varying processing times, which can exceed 24 hours
* Meet the essential nutritional needs of asylum seekers

**Trade Agreements**

This requirement is subject to the provisions of the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and all international free trade agreements, including the World Trade Organization-Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-GPA).

**Solicitation Documents**

All relevant material/documentation will be posted on CanadaBuys at the same time as this Notice of Proposed Procurement.

**Bidders Information**

Interested bidders must submit their proposals in accordance with the tender documents and requirements outlined in the solicitation synopsis. Debriefings may be requested by bidders within 15 working days from receipt of the results of the bid solicitation process.

**Contact Information**

Nathalie Gervais
nathalie.gervais@cbsa-asfc.gc.ca
(819) 574-8150

**Attachments**

The solicitation documents can be found at the following link: <https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/7690/1000451663---pr122403-rfp.pdf> (English) and <https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/7690/1000451663-pr122403-ddp.pdf> (French) Tina is available to assist in establishing a relationship with CWME teams and government of Canada's innovation initiatives.
